purpose: Define the operational control structure that governs all system behaviour, including telemetry, integrity, governance, runtime, and emergent functions.

telemetryControl.description: Ensures the system reports true and current state information.
telemetryControl.enforcement: Telemetry anomalies trigger alerts and governance review.

integrityControl.description: Protects sealed files, manifests, and phase definitions.
integrityControl.response: Rejects unauthorised changes and raises audit entries.

governanceControl.description: Evaluates all system proposals and behavioural decisions.

runtimeControl.description: Regulates PowerShell and Node runtime actions.
runtimeControl.enforcement: Runtime requests routed through governance and integrity layers.

emergentControl.description: Ensures Phase 9 behaviour remains safe and predictable.
rules: no autonomous behaviour without stability confirmation
immediate fallback to safe mode if unstable

failureResponse.detection: Any layer may trigger deviation alerts.
failureResponse.containment: The system enters controlled mode to isolate risk.
failureResponse.reporting: All events logged in the audit chain.

summary.statement: WyneOS operational controls ensure predictable, enforceable behaviour across all system layers.
summary.notes: Control definitions apply to all 1.x versions unless replaced by a higher governance decision.
